result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL J ECKOLDT

records.addlTxt: NO CONTACT WITH SCANLAN PARK, MENASHA WI.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

2:30 PM Defendant MICHAEL J ECKOLDT appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda M. Belville appeared by video for MICHAEL J ECKOLDT.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 237
(per jail list - BBH scheduled before CC Heywood)

Defendant MICHAEL J ECKOLDT not in court.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for MICHAEL J ECKOLDT.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Competency evaluation not completed as WFU indicated defendant was a no show for appointment.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
From WFU indicating the defendant's failure to appear for scheduled appointment to meet and psychologist's inability to reach defendant via phone

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: competency hearing notice (for hearing on 11-01-22) sent to DE - no forwarding address
Winnebago County Jail called and informed clerk defendant posted bond and released from custody
Competency hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
NO CONTACT WITH SCANLAN PARK, MENASHA WI.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

2:37 PM  Defendant MICHAEL J ECKOLDT appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer appeared by video for MICHAEL J ECKOLDT.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties. Bond set.  Court orders competency exam. Record closed @ 2:47.

Defendant MICHAEL J ECKOLDT not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is refusing to come to court from the jail.  He refuses to appear via video or in person.   There is an AIA scheduled before Court Commissioner Heywood at 2:30 today.   Branch 6 will not schedule hearing until after the hearing in front of commissioner.

3:04 PM Defendant MICHAEL J ECKOLDT not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Jail has informed that Defendant has refused to come to court until he has an attorney, however, he declined the public defender once again today. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present to make a statement.  
Good cause found to adjourn initial appearance and State wishes for the court to order the appearance of defendant via video.  Record closed @ 3:08
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:11 PM Defendant MICHAEL J ECKOLDT in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties. Defendant does not wish to proceed without counsel.  Probable cause found and will adjourn. Record closed @ 3:15
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
